citeinfo.origin: Plumb, Glenn. E., Jerrold L.Dodd, and J. Brad Stelfox
citeinfo.title: A Bibliography on Bison

pubinfo.publish: University of Wyoming, Agricultural Experiment Station

citeinfo.othercit: Northern Prairie Wildlife Research Center Home Page

descript.abstract: This bibliography lists literature (including selected agency reports and unpublished theses) on North American bison (Bison bison) with selected literature concerning European bison (Bison bonasus) also included.
descript.purpose: The purpose in compiling this bibliography is to provide a useful reference source for biologists conducting research on bison.

citeinfo.origin: Plumb, Glenn. E., Jerrold L. Dodd, and J. Brad Stelfox
citeinfo.title: A bibliography on bison (Bison bison)

pubinfo.publish: University of Wyoming, Agricultural Experiment Station

dataqual.complete: Since the list is meant for those biologists conducting research on bison, this list does not include popular articles with little scientific merit. We have also omitted the historical and archeological literature except where relevant discussion applies to bison biology or management.

procstep.procdesc: The authors compiled literature concerning the European bison including selected agency reports and unpublished theses.

overview.eaover: Entity - Bison; Associated attributes - bibliography - classification and paleoecology, social organization and behavior, foraging and habitat ecology, growth and bioenergentics, diseases and parasites, census and capture techniques, herd status and management.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Geological Survey, Northern Prairie Wildlife Research Center

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a U.S. Geological Survey server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The U.S. Geological Survey shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Biological Data Profile of the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
